Text.Value: *For the briefest moment, you feel the touch of a reassuring hand on your shoulder. Mystra has noted your service.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself - a job well done

Text.Value: I'll find my own way of destroying the circle.
Well, it wasn't in his published archives - it was merely a sketch. He invoked Mystra's guidance on how to complete it.
*It doesn't take much. The sigils fade, the circle's tainted magic dissolving harmlessly into the ether.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out confidently towards the sigil, focused on its destruction. The sigil flares briefly, then fades. It's extinguished.

Text.Value: Is it dangerous?
Craft the Shadow Lantern.
I'd advise against it - in your case, at least. No disrespect intended, but this is not your typical magic.
Destroy the ritual circle yourself.
It's your choice Gale. Whatever you want to do.
Let me deal with the circle.
Go ahead, then. Do your worst.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mildly peeved you didn't let him do it. Doesn't think this will go well.

Text.Value: Yes, I think I'd be able to craft one more lantern. And with a slight modification of the casting gesture, it might be able to wield the shadows instead of repelling them...

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Text.Value: Not bad for a wizard who slept through his Calishite lessons, eh?
*It doesn't take much. The sigils fade, the circle's tainted magic dissolving harmlessly into the ether.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches out confidently towards the sigil, focused on its destruction. The sigil flares briefly, then fades. It's extinguished.

Text.Value: Attempt to use the ritual circle yourself. Pick up the ingredients and craft the shadow lantern.
*For a moment, you feel a cold hand on your shoulder. Then, an absence. Mystra's blessing has been withdrawn, as has her approval. But the lantern... that is yours to command.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale frowns slightly, he wasn't expecting to lose Mystra's blessing

Text.Value: Oh, charming. I hope the Shadow Weave was to blame for that little outburst of unwarranted discourtesy.
Pick up the ingredients and attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.
Or did you wish to use it? I assure you - it's pointless. You'll have nothing more than a sore head and a very dissatisfied wizard to show for it.
I know of the Weavepasha - you speak of Acham el Jhotos. But I don't recall seeing anything like this in his works...
Pick up the ingedients. Craft the Shadow Lantern.
Leave.
*You feel a tingle run down your spine. A thrill, or a shudder? When such power is now yours to command, does it really matter?*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself - a job well done

Text.Value: Craft the Shadow Lantern.
Pick up the ingedients. Craft the Shadow Lantern.
The discarded pixie corpses might still contain enough essence, and with one of the broken lantern casements...

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Text.Value: *Though its power is weakened, you could still use the shattered pixies Balthazar discarded to craft one final lantern - not to repel the shadows, but to wield them.*
Really? Sometimes your lack of impetus is quite astonishing.

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit snipp, but accepting the decision

Text.Value: Some room then, if you please.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player gives Gale some space (excuse to have him alone in next shot)
EditorData.NodeContext: With a small sigh - knows this is the right thing to do but a bit disappointed nonetheless

Text.Value: Leave it be.
*Mystra forbids the use of such magic. She would insist the sigils be destroyed, the circle's evil dissipated. But she is not here, and you are.*
It's inert, if that's what you mean. But it still reeks of the Shadow Weave, and its polluting magic will continue to escape for as long as it lies abandoned here.
It was a quite fascinating design, though the version created here is a strange corruption of the Weavepasha's original intent.
Attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.
*Carved into the bench's rotted surface is some kind of ritual circle, its sigils half-faded. Darkness and decay hangs in the air around it.*
*Carved into the bench's rotted surface are strange, half-faded sigils. A magic circle of some kind, thick with darkness and decay.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

Text.Value: We shouldn't interfere with it. Leave it alone.
*The circle's power remains. To be used, or destroyed.*
Destroy this foul thing, before it pollutes any further.
Attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.
If you think you know best, go right ahead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Peeved, ready to let you mess it up

Text.Value: Mystra's not here, and I am. I say you go for it. Craft the lantern.
Attempt to use the ritual circle yourself. Craft the shadow lantern.
I think you should forge the lantern, Gale.
Though... Mystra's eyes may be upon me, and she'd forbid me dabbling with such magic. She'd want it destroyed. Wasted, arguably.

EditorData.NodeContext: Coming back to himself after getting carried away, remembering he might get in trouble for creating the lantern. A hint he'd like you to encourage him to use it.

Text.Value: Deal with it how? I hate to pull rank, but I was once Mystra's Chosen. Destroying magic like this was my bread and butter.
*The circle is broken. Nothing but scuff marks on rotted wood.*
Let's just leave the thing be.
Gods, you're obstinate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Muttering to himseld, peeved you didn't let him do it

Text.Value: There's a reason you're Mystra's former Chosen. So let me handle it.
It's time. Destroy the ritual circle, Gale.
Can we use it?
A ritual circle... and a complex one, at that. I've seen such a construction before, in the writings of the Weavepasha of Almraiven, though his vision was not so... tainted.
Erase the shadow sigils.
Very well. Destroy the circle Gale.
It's been mostly drained, but even now contains a powerful dose of Shadow Weave.

EditorData.NodeContext: Advising/warning the player -this is dangerous stuff

Text.Value: Fine. Go ahead Gale - craft this lantern of yours.
Not how I would have done it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sulky, a bit annoyed you didn't let him do it

Text.Value: What is its purpose?
Very well. Stand back, if you please.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale closes his eyes, asking himself the question - what does he want to do?

Text.Value: Pick up the ingredients and attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.
Erase the shadow sigils.
*A ritual circle. Judging by the shadow sigils inscribed, it was used in the creation of Balthazar's Moonlanterns.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

Text.Value: And rightly so. The last thing we need is someone of your potential becoming enthralled with Shar's magic, Gale.
Forget what Mystra wants - think about yourself, and what Lady Shar's power could do for you, Gale. Make the Lantern - spread her will.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'And rightly so' = SH turned from Shar. 'Forget what Mystra wants' = SH loyal to Shar.

Text.Value: The sigils are written in a curious mix of tongues - ancient Calishite, Netherese, and something else I can't quite make out. If I'm reading it correctly - it was used in the creation of Moonlanterns.

Synopsis: Gale finds the way Balthazar has been enchanting Moonlanterns and decides to steal some of his methodology.
